word:
We must have a house of worship erected in Melbourne, so that those who embrace unpopular truth may feel that they have a church home. We shall need money for the forwarding of this enterprise, and those who invest in this work will see blessed results in this world, but will not fully know the consequences of their beneficence until the judgment shall sit, until every man shall be rewarded according to his works.--Letter 99, 1895. 





Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. June 8, 1989. Entire Letter.
